content.description: Skin the Cat is the next route to the right from Looker.  It is a bit steeper than the neighboring route but has an abundance of huge holds.  Super-fun climb.  Lower with a 60m rope.
This is the left-most route on Site 18.  The crux is on the lower part of the route, involving balancy moves on small edges.  Solid holds and fun moves await above.  Lower with a 60m rope.

Tired of clipping bolts?  Check out this route while you are in the area.  It will add a little excitement.

Undercling up to the first bolt, and fish in some small cams before the headwall.  A thin crack leads to the top of the wall with good gear.  A gear anchor can be made at the top with large nuts, small hexs, and a #3 camalot.

It is easy enough to traverse over from the anchors of "Bomber" and clean your gear.
content.protection: one bolt, small cams, and a good selection of nuts
content.location: The third route from the left...

content.description: The right-most route on the Site 18 wall.  Start with easy moves to reach the first bolt, then climb on small holds to gain a large horizontal crack/ledge.  The next couple moves above the ledge constitute the crux of the climb, then it's off to the chains with plenty of good holds to work with.  Lower with a 60m rope.
If anyone knows who bolted this or what it is called, please comment and let me know. This is now the left most route and it is a stellar climb for this looking for a series of challenging moves.
content.location: LEFT MOST ROUTE. Left of Looker. Walk up the rock under Looker and continue up until just before the channel.
